704471f-a.text:
Fulton Street, at the N.W. corner of Furman Street. A view of the Brooklyn City Flour Mills, owned by Jewell Brothers, who organized the Jewell Milling Company in 1880. (This site no longer serves as a mill in 1908). On the opposite corner (S.W.), was a railroad terminus for passengers from and to New York. The Brooklyn Bridge
was still under construction.

About 1880 ?

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
704471f-a.folder: Fulton Street & Furman Street, Brooklyn, NY

704588f-a.text:
Furman Street, north side, between Fulton and Water Streets, showing the former Fulton Street Ferry House, still standing in 1929.
July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704588f-a.folder: Furman Street & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY

707326f-a.text:
Water Street, north side, between Fulton (left), and New Dock Streets (right). In the background, is seen the Manhattan Bridge.
February 5, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
